sean machin wrote:

> Hey Guys,
> 
> Just a basic question here; if I have a bunch of Junit tests, and there is
> no requirement about their order of execution, and I run the tests from Ant
> via "batchtest" (running all tests in my test directory), is it true that I
> do not need to specify suites for any of my tests?

Let me see whether I understand your question:

You can run your tests in any order, and you're wondering whether you 
need to build custom suites (AllTests classes)?

If so, the answer is "no". You can use <batchtest> to collect all your 
tests using wildcard patterns for filenames without having to specify 
custom suite methods (suite()) or AllTests classes.

See _JUnit Recipes_, chapters 3 and 6 for details.
